meanings.definition: To lean to one side, as a ship under the pressure of wind.
meanings.sent1: The boat was heeling in the strong wind.
meanings.sent2: The tree was heeling over in the storm.
meanings.sent3: The tower of blocks was heeling precariously.
meanings.sent4: The leaning tower was heeling dangerously.
meanings.sent5: The ship was heeling dramatically, almost tipping over.

meanings.definition: To follow at the heels of someone.
meanings.sent1: The dog was heeling obediently beside its owner.
meanings.sent2: The detective was heeling the suspect through the crowded street.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat was heeling the group of children.
meanings.sent4: The shadow was heeling the person closely, unnoticed.
meanings.sent5: The loyal assistant was heeling the boss everywhere.

meanings.definition: The act of striking with the heel of the foot.
meanings.sent1: Her heeling of the ground showed her frustration.
meanings.sent2: The dancer's heeling on the stage was precise and powerful.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's heeling on the floor made a rhythmic sound.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's heeling in the race was swift and impactful.
meanings.sent5: The boxer's heeling on the opponent was a knockout move.
